details:
The OpenSSL project reports:

> The OpenSSL 3.0.4 release introduced a serious bug in the RSA
> implementation for X86\_64 CPUs supporting the AVX512IFMA instructions.
> This issue makes the RSA implementation with 2048 bit private keys
> incorrect on such machines and memory corruption will happen during
> the computation. As a consequence of the memory corruption an attacker
> may be able to trigger a remote code execution on the machine performing
> the computation.
>
> SSL/TLS servers or other servers using 2048 bit RSA private keys running
> on machines supporting AVX512IFMA instructions of the X86\_64 architecture
> are affected by this issue.
summary: OpenSSL -- Heap memory corruption with RSA private key operation
